data.title: Interview with Adolf Joseph Ferdinand Galland
data.meta_description: German officer served as pilot with 27th Fighter Wing, German Air Force in France and Germany, 1940; commanded III Group, 27th Fighter Wing, German Air Force in France, 6/1940-12/1941 including Battle of Britain, 1940; served as General der Jagdfleiger in Germany, 1941-1945; commanded 44th Hunting Group, German Air Force in Germany, 1945
data.text:
This media is not currently available online. Contact the Image and Film Licensing team about access

Description

Object description

German officer served as pilot with 27th Fighter Wing, German Air Force in France and Germany, 1940; commanded III Group, 27th Fighter Wing, German Air Force in France, 6/1940-12/1941 including Battle of Britain, 1940; served as General der Jagdfleiger in Germany, 1941-1945; commanded 44th Hunting Group, German Air Force in Germany, 1945

Content description

REEL 1 Aspects of operations as pilot with 27th Fighter Wing, German Air Force in Germany and France, 1940: circumstances of failure of Germans to prevent escape of British Army from Dunkirk, France, 5/1940-6/1940; opinion that Adolf Hitler did not want war with GB 1940. Recollections of operations commanding III Group 27th Fighter Wing, German Air Force in France, 6/1940-12/1941 including Battle of Britain, 1940: restrictions of German Air Force operations over GB, 6/1940-7/1940; plan to establish air superiority over GB; question of Hermann GÃ¶ring's over-estimation of German Air Force superiority; inaccurate German estimates of British aircraft strength and effectiveness of British radar; difficulty of attacking as opposed to defending; opinion of Royal Air Force fighter pilots; German Air Force's decision to attack London, GB; view of German Air Force aircrew as to success of battle. REEL 2 Continues: opinion that German Air Force unable to secure victory during battle alone; reasons for variable success after switch to night bombing autumn 1940; reason for raid on London, 10/5/1941. Aspects of period as General der Jagdflieger and 44th Hunting Group, German Air Force in Germany, 1941-1945: effect of Allied bombing campaign on Germany; success of German Air Force fighters intercepting United States Army Air Force Eighth Air Force raid against Schweinfurt, 1943; German shortage of fuel, problems during development of Messerschmitt Me 262 fighters, 1944-1945.

Our collections information

We have over a million object records online, and we are adding to this all the time. Our records are never finished. Sometimes we discover new information that changes what we know about an object, such as who made it or used it. Sometimes we change how an object is interpreted. We sometimes make mistakes in our spelling, transcription or categorisation, or miss information out of our records.

Second World War

How Britain Celebrated Christmas During The Second World War

Six years of war brought many changes to familiar festive rituals. Christmas celebrations during the Second World War often had to be scaled down or adjusted as restrictions and shortages took their toll.
